龐.definition: (bound form) huge; (bound form) numerous and disordered; (bound form) face

龐加萊.definition: Henri Poincaré (1854-1912), French mathematician, physicist and philosopher

龐培.definition: Pompeium, Roman town in Bay of Naples destroyed by eruption of Vesuvius in 79; Pompey (Roman general)

龐家堡區.definition: Pangjiabao district of Zhangjiakou city, Hebei

龐德.definition: Pang De (-219), general of Cao Wei at the start of the Three Kingdoms period, victor over Guan Yu 關羽|关羽; Pound (name); Ezra Pound (1885-1972), American poet and translator

龐氏.definition: Ponzi (name); Pond's (brand of skin care products), also written 旁氏

龐涓.definition: Pang Juan (-342 BC), military leader and political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)

龐貝.definition: Pompeii, ancient Roman town near Naples, Italy
